results.title: Office killer
results.creator_credit: Cindy Sherman, Pamela Koffler, Christine Vachon and Artfear Productions
results.brief_description: Usually known for her extensive career in photography spanning over 20 years, Cindy Sherman directs her first feature film and brings to life the characters that she has depicted within her photography. Dorine (Kane) is the company doormat, seemingly obliging and mild mannered until one day she accidentally electrocutes a fellow worker, who happens to be her most obnoxious opponent. The unhinged Dorine continues her killing spree believing that all can be friends when dead. Her antics verge on discovery when the bitchy co-worker played by Molly Ringwald suspects that all is not okay. Following in the b-grade genre of film-making, Sherman delights with an excess of gory special effects. Cast also includes: Jeanne Tripplehorn.

results.title: Gas, food lodging
results.creator_credit: Allison Anders, Daniel Hassid, William Ewart, Seth Willenson and Cineville
results.brief_description: Set in Laramie, New Mexico, this film deals with the relationship between a single mother and her two teenage daughters, complicated by small town isolation. The film explores the notion of family as it tackles issues of love, death, sex and escape. Stars Brooke Adams, Ione Skye and Fairuza Balk in the lead roles. Cast also includes James Brolin, Robert Knepper, David Landsbury, Chris Mulkey and Donovan Leitch. Screenplay by Alison Anders, based on the novel ‘Don’t Look and It Won’t Hurt’ by Richard Peck. Edited by Tracy S. Granger. Photographed by Dean Lent. Music composed by J. Mascis.

results.title: Flying elephants
results.creator_credit: Fred J. Butler, Hal Roach and Kodak Cinegraph
results.brief_description: Set in the Stone Age when men were forced to marry and then work on the rock pile - that’s why it was called the “Stone Age!”. King Ferdinand has ordered that all men between the ages of 13 and 95 must be married within 21 days or be executed or banished for life, or both. Amongst those vying for a wife are the big husky caveman known as the Mighty Giant (Oliver Hardy) and his rival, Twinkle Star (Stan Laurel).

results.title: A Small town idol
results.creator_credit: Mack Sennett, Erle C Kenton and Mack Sennett Comedies
results.brief_description: Slapstick comedy about small town resident, Sam Smith (Ben Turpin) who has been framed for stealing by the scoundrel J. Wellington Jones as a ploy to stop him from wooing Mary (Phyllis Haver), the prettiest single girl in town. Cast also includes Charlie Murray, Marie Prevost, Billy Bevan.

results.title: Kiss me deadly
results.brief_description: A chance encounter leading to, what is referred to in the film as, the search for ‘the great whatsit’, follows the conventional investigative structure of the private eye film. However, the bravura visual style, the array of characterisation and the aural fabric of allusion and metaphor add meaning to this basic structure, marking the film as the climax of the initial noir cycle. The private eye, Mike Hammer, is portrayed as a fascistic anti-hero ultimately caught between big crime and big government. Aldrich and Bezzerides consciously denounce Spillane’s sleazy creation injecting in its place an atmosphere of cold war hysteria, an implicit critique of the ‘end justifies the means’ mentality.

results.title: Triple trouble
results.creator_credit: Leo White, Charles Chaplin and Essanay Film Manufacturing Company
results.brief_description: A slapstick comedy starring Charlie Chaplin as a screwball kitchenhand who unwittingly foils Colonel W. Nutt’s scientific research and in the process involves everyone around him in a search for local train robbers. Also stars: Billy Armstrong, Albert Austin, Henry Bergman, Bud Jamison, James J. Kelley, ‘Snub’ Pollard, Edna Purviance, Wesley Ruggles and Leo White.

results.title: Dark wind
results.creator_credit: Errol Morris, Patrick Markey and Northfork Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Dark Wind is a tangled web of deceit between two law enforcements. Lou Diamond Phillips plays Jim Chee a young police officer working on a reserve in Arizona belonging to the Navajo’s. He finds himself in constant dispute with the local sheriff of the Hopi clan who want to share the reserve with the Navajo’s. Into the web is a robbery, a plane crash and a decaying body that has been in the desert for some time and the mysterious call in the wind of death. Nothing is as it seems in this electric thriller set amongst ritual and superstition of the people of Arizona. Cast also includes Fred Ward, Gary Farmer, John Karlen.

results.title: Last resort [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Pawel Pawlikowski, Ruth Caleb and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description: The low key Last Resort is an offbeat love story set around a defunct British seaside holiday resort. Russian immigrant Tanya (Dina Korzun) arrives at Gatwick airport with her ten year old son Artiom (Artiom Strelinikov) to be reunited with her British fiance. When he doesn’t arrive the distressed Tanya rashly decides to claim political asylum in order to stay in the country. She is then taken to a refuge holding center situated in an abandoned holiday resort where she virtually becomes a prisoner. While detained she meets amusement arcade manager Alfie (Paddy Considine) an ex-crim who takes Tanya and her son under his wings. Soon enough an unlikely romance develops between the pair. Director Pawel Pawlikowski handles his material delicately eliciting some wonderful naturalistic performances from his leads. While cinematographer Ryszard Lenczewski adds to the melancholy nature of the film by giving the look of the once thriving fun park an eerie beauty. Cast includes Lindsey Honey, Dave Bean, Katie Drinkwater. Pawel Pawlikowski: Winner of the 2001 BAFTA award for the Most Promising Newcomer in British Film.

results.title: Alice and Martin = Alice et Martin
results.creator_credit: Andre Techine, Alain Sarde, October Films, Les Films Alain Sarde, Studio Canal+, France 3 Cinema and France 2 Cinema
results.brief_description: After his father’s death, twenty year old Martin (Alexis Loret) goes missing. He eventually reappears at his brother’s Paris apartment and moves in with him and his housemate Alice (Juliette Binoche). Martin finds success as a fashion model and begins a tentative sexual relationship with the shy Alice. But when Martin hears that she has fallen pregnant this results in a breakdown where the shattering truth of what occurred during his disappearance threatens to destroy him and his relationship. As Techine showed in his earlier work, “Wild Reeds”, he is a master of acute observations of human need and desire. The fractured individuals at the heart of “Alice and Martin” are all seeking solace and safety. Neither detachedly bleak nor fashionably cynical, Techine’s work recalls the strong humanist tradition in French cinema: he is certainly Jean Renoir’s heir. But this is no revisionist or conservative cinema. Techine’s fine intimate portraits are alive to both the possibilities of cinema and the complex sexual and gender relationships at the core of modern life. With Carmen Maura. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Water drops on burning rocks = Gouttes d'eau sur pierres brulantes
results.creator_credit: Francois Ozon, Alain Sarde, Marc Missonnier, Olivier Delbosc, Eurospace, Les Films Alain Sarde and Fidelite Productions
results.brief_description: Based on Rainer Werner Fassbinder’s play “Tropfen auf hiesse Steine” this richly perverse and very funny sex comedy stars Bernard Giraudeau as Leopold, an ultra successful and ultra conservative businessman who seduces the young Franz. But when Franz moves in, all expectations are overturned when it is Leopold who refuses to compromise to Franz’s old fashioned sense of morality and domesticity. Franz turns to his ex-girlfriend for comfort but she too ends up falling for Leopold’s cold seductive charms. Their bizarre menage-a-trois is then interrupted when Leopold’s ex, Vera, a male to female transsexual, comes for a visit. Rather than needlessly “opening up” the original play’s stagebound scenes, Ozon instead creates a slightly surreal enclosed space in which the four actors are able to create characters both bizarre but also strikingly realistic. The crisp, imaginative direction allows for both the humour of the original play, as well as its cruelty, to be fully expressed. A wonderfully fresh and stylish comedy of manners, “Water Drops on Burning Rocks” is a splendid example of how queer cinema can transgress both heterosexual and homosexual normative ideals. Cast includes Malik Zidi, Ludivine Sagnier and Anna Levine. In French with English subtitles.
